Description: Small marl pottery jar of squat globular shape, with rounded base, everted ledge rim, two short cylindrical handles on shoulder. Exterior decorated in red-brown paint with spirals of various sizes and isolated wavy lines. Wavy lines also painted over handles
Curator's comments: Closest parallel is Decorated Ware D67l in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Condition: fair; top of rim is worn and chipped, surface on body is worn
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs I C Turnbull
